title.zh_CN: Words of Wisdom delivered at The Temple Of Ultimate Bliss of Tainan Taiwan—Learn to be humble and to respect others
title.zh_TW: Words of Wisdom delivered at The Temple Of Ultimate Bliss of Tainan Taiwan—Learn to be humble and to respect others

paragraphs.zh_CN: During the Declining Age of the Dharma, there is no way to attain Buddhahood except by reciting "Amitabha".
paragraphs.zh_TW: During the Declining Age of the Dharma, there is no way to attain Buddhahood except by reciting "Amitabha".

paragraphs.zh_CN: Just think it through, you will realize how hard it is to sever yourself from desires.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Just think it through, you will realize how hard it is to sever yourself from desires.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Reciting "Amitabha" is the only way that enables people to attain Buddhahood by going to Amitabha's Pure Land after death so long they succeed in suppressing their desires.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Reciting "Amitabha" is the only way that enables people to attain Buddhahood by going to Amitabha's Pure Land after death so long they succeed in suppressing their desires.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Without that way, we will not be able to make it.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Without that way, we will not be able to make it.

paragraphs.zh_CN: You have got to weigh the pros and cons carefully, If you cannot sever yourselves from all desires, then you should take the easier way by reciting "Amitabha" wholeheartedly.
paragraphs.zh_TW: You have got to weigh the pros and cons carefully, If you cannot sever yourselves from all desires, then you should take the easier way by reciting "Amitabha" wholeheartedly.

paragraphs.zh_CN: This will definitely set you on the course to success.
paragraphs.zh_TW: This will definitely set you on the course to success.

paragraphs.zh_CN: So, if you can sever yourselves from all your desires, fine.
paragraphs.zh_TW: So, if you can sever yourselves from all your desires, fine.

paragraphs.zh_CN: But if you cannot do that, then following any other way will be a dangerous course, full of pitfalls for you to fall into, and you will not succeed attaining Buddhahood.
paragraphs.zh_TW: But if you cannot do that, then following any other way will be a dangerous course, full of pitfalls for you to fall into, and you will not succeed attaining Buddhahood.

paragraphs.zh_CN: We must understand well that only this way can save the sentient beings of the Age of Declining Dharma.
paragraphs.zh_TW: We must understand well that only this way can save the sentient beings of the Age of Declining Dharma.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Devoted to taking this approach by practising and introducing to others the recitation of "Amitabha", you will then succeed one day.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Devoted to taking this approach by practising and introducing to others the recitation of "Amitabha", you will then succeed one day.

paragraphs.zh_CN: To be a person is to learn to be humble.
paragraphs.zh_TW: To be a person is to learn to be humble.

paragraphs.zh_CN: If you learn to respect others, then you will succeed.
paragraphs.zh_TW: If you learn to respect others, then you will succeed.

paragraphs.zh_CN: As the saying goes, "As you respect others, they will also respect you".
paragraphs.zh_TW: As the saying goes, "As you respect others, they will also respect you".

paragraphs.zh_CN: Being arrogant is the worst.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Being arrogant is the worst.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Once you are full of yourself, you are finished, you have no future.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Once you are full of yourself, you are finished, you have no future.

paragraphs.zh_CN: You must learn to be humble no matter how great you are.
paragraphs.zh_TW: You must learn to be humble no matter how great you are.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Why?
paragraphs.zh_TW: Why?

paragraphs.zh_CN: Because all sentient beings and the Buddhas are one, they are equal, there is no difference.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Because all sentient beings and the Buddhas are one, they are equal, there is no difference.

paragraphs.zh_CN: There is no difference.
paragraphs.zh_TW: There is no difference.

paragraphs.zh_CN: If you insist on differentiating, then you are wrong.
paragraphs.zh_TW: If you insist on differentiating, then you are wrong.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Being equal is to teach you to be humble and to respect others.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Being equal is to teach you to be humble and to respect others.

paragraphs.zh_CN: This is real equality.
paragraphs.zh_TW: This is real equality.

paragraphs.zh_CN: It does not manifest itself in arrogance.
paragraphs.zh_TW: It does not manifest itself in arrogance.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Every Buddha, every Bodhisattva, is humility itself.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Every Buddha, every Bodhisattva, is humility itself.

paragraphs.zh_CN: I often talk about humility.
paragraphs.zh_TW: I often talk about humility.

paragraphs.zh_CN: As Professor Thome H. Fang put it, "Studying Buddhism is the greatest pleasure in life".
paragraphs.zh_TW: As Professor Thome H. Fang put it, "Studying Buddhism is the greatest pleasure in life".

paragraphs.zh_CN: Have you experienced the greatest pleasure in life?
paragraphs.zh_TW: Have you experienced the greatest pleasure in life?

paragraphs.zh_CN: I have.
paragraphs.zh_TW: I have.

paragraphs.zh_CN: That is why I believe what he said.
paragraphs.zh_TW: That is why I believe what he said.

paragraphs.zh_CN: What is the greatest pleasure?
paragraphs.zh_TW: What is the greatest pleasure?

paragraphs.zh_CN: Be humble and respect others, that is the greatest pleasure.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Be humble and respect others, that is the greatest pleasure.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Praise others to the sky and bring yourself down, that is the greatest happiness, the greatest pleasure.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Praise others to the sky and bring yourself down, that is the greatest happiness, the greatest pleasure.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Buddha respects others.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Buddha respects others.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Buddha Amitabha praises all other Buddhas.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Buddha Amitabha praises all other Buddhas.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Definitely, those who are arrogant, those who sing their own praises, and those who destroy others will never attain peace and happiness.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Definitely, those who are arrogant, those who sing their own praises, and those who destroy others will never attain peace and happiness.

paragraphs.zh_CN: The Bible of Christianity also promotes humility.
paragraphs.zh_TW: The Bible of Christianity also promotes humility.

paragraphs.zh_CN: If you can achieve hating no one in your life, then you are almost there; but if you still have enemy or foe, or people you dislike or people you are unhappy with, then you are rather far away from your goal.
paragraphs.zh_TW: If you can achieve hating no one in your life, then you are almost there; but if you still have enemy or foe, or people you dislike or people you are unhappy with, then you are rather far away from your goal.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Where should we start learning to become a Buddha?
paragraphs.zh_TW: Where should we start learning to become a Buddha?

paragraphs.zh_CN: By letting go.
paragraphs.zh_TW: By letting go.

paragraphs.zh_CN: What should we let go of?
paragraphs.zh_TW: What should we let go of?

paragraphs.zh_CN: Letting go of your arrogance, letting go of your many bad habits.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Letting go of your arrogance, letting go of your many bad habits.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Start from right here, so you won't be wasting your efforts.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Start from right here, so you won't be wasting your efforts.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Learn to be humble and to respect others, and you will find real happiness and spiritual joy.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Learn to be humble and to respect others, and you will find real happiness and spiritual joy.
